labels.analysis: The MCP Server, Aindreyway Codex Keeper, focuses on managing and accessing development documentation and best practices. Its tools are designed to curate, update, and search through documentation sources, ensuring AI assistants have the latest and most relevant information. This aligns with maintaining a structured knowledge base for development tasks, compliance with standards, and best practices.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality revolves around managing and retrieving documentation, which is central to **Memory Management** (storing and accessing knowledge). The focus on development documentation also ties it to **Development Tools**, though Memory Management is more encompassing of its core purpose. No custom label is necessary as the predefined categories sufficiently cover its functionality.

tools.name: list_documentation
tools.description: List all available documentation sources. Use this tool to discover relevant documentation before starting tasks to ensure best practices and standards compliance.

tools.name: add_documentation
tools.description: Add a new documentation source. When working on tasks, add any useful documentation you discover to help maintain a comprehensive knowledge base.

tools.name: update_documentation
tools.description: Update documentation content from source. Always update relevant documentation before starting a task to ensure you have the latest information and best practices.

name.description: Name of the documentation to update

force.description: Force update even if recently updated

tools.name: search_documentation
tools.description: Search through documentation content. Use this to find specific information, best practices, or guidelines relevant to your current task. Remember to check documentation before making important decisions.

tools.name: remove_documentation
tools.description: Remove a documentation source. Use this when you no longer need specific documentation.

name.description: Name of the documentation to remove

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@aindreyway/mcp-codex-keeper/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
